063/**
064 * CLI subcommand to execute actor-IaC workflows.
065 *
066 * <p>This is the main workflow execution command. It supports executing workflows
067 * defined in YAML, JSON, or XML format with optional overlay configuration.</p>
068 *
069 * <h2>Usage</h2>
070 * <pre>
071 * actor-iac run -d /path/to/workflows -w main-workflow.yaml
072 * actor-iac run --dir ./workflows --workflow deploy --threads 8
073 * actor-iac run -d ./workflows -w deploy -i inventory.ini -g webservers
074 * </pre>
075 *
076 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
077 * @since 2.10.0
078 */
079@Command(
080    name = "run",
081    mixinStandardHelpOptions = true,
082    version = "actor-IaC run 2.12.0",
083    description = "Execute actor-IaC workflows defined in YAML, JSON, or XML format."
084)
085public class RunCLI implements Callable<Integer> {
086
087    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(RunCLI.class.getName());
088    private static final String ACTORIAC_VERSION = "2.12.0";
089
090    @Option(
091        names = {"-d", "--dir"},
092        description = "Directory containing workflow files (searched recursively)"
093    )
094    private File workflowDir;
095
096    @Option(
097        names = {"-w", "--workflow"},
098        description = "Name of the main workflow to execute (with or without extension)"
099    )
100    private String workflowName;
101
102    @Option(
103        names = {"-i", "--inventory"},
104        description = "Path to Ansible inventory file (enables node-based execution)"
105    )
106    private File inventoryFile;
107
108    @Option(
109        names = {"-g", "--group"},
110        description = "Name of the host group to target (requires --inventory)",
111        defaultValue = "all"
112    )
113    private String groupName;
114
115    @Option(
116        names = {"-t", "--threads"},
117        description = "Number of worker threads for CPU-bound operations (default: ${DEFAULT-VALUE})",
118        defaultValue = "4"
119    )
120    private int threads;
121
122    @Option(
123        names = {"-v", "--verbose"},
124        description = "Enable verbose output"
125    )
126    private boolean verbose;
127
128    @Option(
129        names = {"-o", "--overlay"},
130        description = "Overlay directory containing overlay-conf.yaml for environment-specific configuration"
131    )
132    private File overlayDir;
133
134    @Option(
135        names = {"--file-log", "-l", "--log"},
136        description = "Enable text file logging and specify output path. If not specified, only database logging is used."
137    )
138    private File logFile;
139
140    @Option(
141        names = {"--no-file-log", "--no-log"},
142        description = "Explicitly disable text file logging. (Text logging is disabled by default.)"
143    )
144    private boolean noLog;
145
146    @Option(
147        names = {"--log-db"},
148        description = "H2 database path for distributed logging (default: actor-iac-logs in current directory)"
149    )
150    private File logDbPath;
151
152    @Option(
153        names = {"--no-log-db"},
154        description = "Disable H2 database logging"
155    )
156    private boolean noLogDb;
157
158    @Option(
159        names = {"--log-serve"},
160        description = "H2 log server address (host:port, e.g., localhost:29090). " +
161                     "Enables multiple workflows to share a single log database. " +
162                     "Falls back to embedded mode if server is unreachable."
163    )
164    private String logServer;
165
166    @Option(
167        names = {"--embedded"},
168        description = "Use embedded H2 database mode. " +
169                     "Default behavior is to auto-start a TCP server with auto-shutdown."
170    )
171    private boolean embedded;
172
173    @Option(
174        names = {"-k", "--ask-pass"},
175        description = "Prompt for SSH password (uses password authentication instead of ssh-agent)"
176    )
177    private boolean askPass;
178
179    @Option(
180        names = {"--limit"},
181        description = "Limit execution to specific hosts (comma-separated, e.g., '192.168.5.15' or '192.168.5.15,192.168.5.16')"
182    )
183    private String limitHosts;
184
185    @Option(
186        names = {"-L", "--list-workflows"},
187        description = "List workflows discovered under --dir and exit"
188    )
189    private boolean listWorkflows;
190
191    @Option(
192        names = {"-q", "--quiet"},
193        description = "Suppress all console output (stdout/stderr). Logs are still written to database."
194    )
195    private boolean quiet;
196
197    @Option(
198        names = {"--cowfile", "-c"},
199        description = "Cowsay character to use for step display. " +
200                     "Available: tux, dragon, stegosaurus, kitty, bunny, turtle, elephant, " +
201                     "ghostbusters, vader, and 35 more. Use '--cowfile list' to see all."
202    )
203    private String cowfile;
204
205    @Option(
206        names = {"--render-to"},
207        description = "Render overlay-applied workflows to specified directory (does not execute)"
208    )
209    private File renderToDir;
210
211    /** Cache of discovered workflow files: name -> File */
212    private final Map<String, File> workflowCache = new HashMap<>();
213
214    /** Distributed log store (H2 database) */
215    private DistributedLogStore logStore;
216
217    /** Actor reference for the log store (for async writes) */
218    private ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> logStoreActor;
219
220    /** Dedicated executor service for DB writes */
221    private ExecutorService dbExecutor;
222
223    /** Current session ID for distributed logging */
224    private long sessionId = -1;
225
226    /**
227     * Executes the workflow.
228     *
229     * @return exit code (0 for success, non-zero for failure)
230     */
231    @Override
232    public Integer call() {
233        // Handle --cowfile list: show available cowfiles and exit
234        if ("list".equalsIgnoreCase(cowfile)) {
235            printAvailableCowfiles();
236            return 0;
237        }
238
239        // Validate --dir is required for all other operations
240        if (workflowDir == null) {
241            System.err.println("Missing required option: '--dir=<workflowDir>'");
242            CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
243            return 2;
244        }
245
246        // Validate required options
247        // --render-to only requires --dir and --overlay, not --workflow
248        if (renderToDir != null) {
249            if (overlayDir == null) {
250                if (!quiet) {
251                    System.err.println("--render-to requires '--overlay=<overlayDir>'");
252                    CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
253                }
254                return 2;
255            }
256        } else if (workflowName == null && !listWorkflows) {
257            if (!quiet) {
258                System.err.println("Missing required option: '--workflow=<workflowName>'");
259                System.err.println("Use --list-workflows to see available workflows.");
260                CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
261            }
262            return 2;
263        }
264
265        // In quiet mode, suppress all console output
266        if (quiet) {
267            suppressConsoleOutput();
268        }
269
270        // Configure log level based on verbose flag
271        configureLogLevel(verbose);
272
273        // Setup H2 log database (enabled by default, use --no-log-db to disable)
274        if (!noLogDb) {
275            if (logDbPath == null) {
276                // Default: actor-iac-logs in current directory
277                logDbPath = new File("actor-iac-logs");
278            }
279            try {
280                setupLogDatabase();
281            } catch (SQLException e) {
282                if (!quiet) {
283                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to setup log database: " + e.getMessage());
284                }
285            }
286        }
287
288        // Setup text file logging via H2LogStore (only when -l/--log option is specified)
289        if (logFile != null && logStore != null) {
290            try {
291                setupTextLogging();
292            } catch (IOException e) {
293                if (!quiet) {
294                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to setup text file logging: " + e.getMessage());
295                }
296            }
297        }
298
299        try {
300            return executeMain();
301        } finally {
302            // Clean up resources (H2LogStore.close() also closes text log writer)
303            if (logStore != null) {
304                try {
305                    logStore.close();
306                } catch (Exception e) {
307                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to close log database: " + e.getMessage());
308                }
309            }
310        }
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Suppresses all console output (stdout/stderr) for quiet mode.
315     */
316    private void suppressConsoleOutput() {
317        // Remove ConsoleHandler from root logger
318        Logger rootLogger = Logger.getLogger("");
319        for (java.util.logging.Handler handler : rootLogger.getHandlers()) {
320            if (handler instanceof java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler) {
321                rootLogger.removeHandler(handler);
322            }
323        }
324
325        // Redirect System.out and System.err to null
326        java.io.PrintStream nullStream = new java.io.PrintStream(java.io.OutputStream.nullOutputStream());
327        System.setOut(nullStream);
328        System.setErr(nullStream);
329    }
330
331    /**
332     * Sets up H2 database for distributed logging.
333     *
334     * <p>Connection priority:</p>
335     * <ol>
336     *   <li>If --embedded is specified, use embedded mode</li>
337     *   <li>If --log-serve is specified, connect to that server</li>
338     *   <li>Otherwise (default): auto-detect or start a background TCP server with auto-shutdown</li>
339     * </ol>
340     */
341    private void setupLogDatabase() throws SQLException {
342        Path dbPath = logDbPath.toPath();
343
344        // Priority 1: Explicit embedded mode
345        if (embedded) {
346            logStore = new H2LogStore(dbPath);
347            System.out.println("Log database: " + logDbPath.getAbsolutePath() + ".mv.db (embedded mode)");
348            return;
349        }
350
351        // Priority 2: Explicit log server specified
352        if (logServer != null && !logServer.isBlank()) {
353            logStore = H2LogStore.createWithFallback(logServer, dbPath);
354            System.out.println("Log database: " + logServer + " (TCP mode)");
355            return;
356        }
357
358        // Priority 3 (default): Auto-detect existing server or start a new one
359        LogServerDiscovery discovery = new LogServerDiscovery();
360        LogServerDiscovery.DiscoveryResult result = discovery.discoverServer(dbPath);
361
362        if (result.isFound()) {
363            // Found existing server, connect to it
364            logStore = H2LogStore.createWithFallback(result.getServerAddress(), dbPath);
365            System.out.println("Auto-detected log server at " + result.getServerAddress());
366            System.out.println("Log database: " + result.getServerAddress() + " (TCP mode)");
367            return;
368        }
369
370        // No existing server found - start a background server with auto-shutdown
371        int serverPort = startBackgroundLogServer(dbPath);
372        if (serverPort > 0) {
373            String serverAddress = "localhost:" + serverPort;
374            logStore = H2LogStore.createWithFallback(serverAddress, dbPath);
375            System.out.println("Started background log server on port " + serverPort);
376            System.out.println("Log database: " + serverAddress + " (TCP mode, auto-shutdown enabled)");
377        } else {
378            // Failed to start server, fall back to embedded mode
379            System.out.println("Warning: Failed to start background log server, using embedded mode");
380            logStore = new H2LogStore(dbPath);
381            System.out.println("Log database: " + logDbPath.getAbsolutePath() + ".mv.db (embedded mode)");
382        }
383    }
384
385    /** Background log server process (for auto-shutdown) */
386    private Process backgroundServerProcess;
387
388    /** Background log server port */
389    private int backgroundServerPort = -1;
390
391    /**
392     * Starts a background H2 log server with auto-shutdown.
393     *
394     * <p>The server runs in a separate process and will automatically shut down
395     * when there are no connections for 5 minutes.</p>
396     *
397     * @param dbPath database path
398     * @return the TCP port of the started server, or -1 if failed
399     */
400    private int startBackgroundLogServer(Path dbPath) {
401        // Find an available port in the reserved range
402        int port = findAvailablePort();
403        if (port < 0) {
404            LOG.warning("No available ports in range 29090-29100");
405            return -1;
406        }
407
408        try {
409            // Get the path to actor_iac.java
410            String actorIacPath = findActorIacScript();
411            if (actorIacPath == null) {
412                LOG.warning("Could not find actor_iac.java script");
413                return -1;
414            }
415
416            // Build the command to start log server with auto-shutdown
417            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder(
418                actorIacPath,
419                "log-serve",
420                "--port", String.valueOf(port),
421                "--db", dbPath.toAbsolutePath().toString(),
422                "--auto-shutdown",
423                "--idle-timeout", "300",  // 5 minutes
424                "--check-interval", "60"   // Check every 1 minute
425            );
426
427            // Redirect output to null (server runs silently in background)
428            pb.redirectOutput(ProcessBuilder.Redirect.DISCARD);
429            pb.redirectError(ProcessBuilder.Redirect.DISCARD);
430
431            // Start the server process
432            backgroundServerProcess = pb.start();
433            backgroundServerPort = port;
434
435            // Wait briefly for server to start
436            Thread.sleep(1000);
437
438            // Verify server is running
439            if (!backgroundServerProcess.isAlive()) {
440                LOG.warning("Background log server process exited unexpectedly");
441                return -1;
442            }
443
444            // Verify we can connect
445            LogServerDiscovery.DiscoveryResult verify = new LogServerDiscovery().discoverServer(dbPath);
446            if (!verify.isFound()) {
447                LOG.warning("Background log server started but not responding");
448                backgroundServerProcess.destroy();
449                return -1;
450            }
451
452            if (verbose) {
453                LOG.info("Background log server started on port " + port + " (PID: " + backgroundServerProcess.pid() + ")");
454            }
455
456            return port;
457
458        } catch (Exception e) {
459            LOG.warning("Failed to start background log server: " + e.getMessage());
460            return -1;
461        }
462    }
463
464    /**
465     * Finds an available port in the actor-IaC reserved range (29090-29100).
466     */
467    private int findAvailablePort() {
468        int[] ports = {29090, 29091, 29092, 29093, 29094, 29095, 29096, 29097, 29098, 29099, 29100};
469        for (int port : ports) {
470            try (java.net.Socket socket = new java.net.Socket("localhost", port)) {
471                // Port is in use
472            } catch (Exception e) {
473                // Port is available
474                return port;
475            }
476        }
477        return -1;
478    }
479
480    /**
481     * Finds the path to the actor_iac.java script.
482     */
483    private String findActorIacScript() {
484        // Try common locations
485        String[] candidates = {
486            "./actor_iac.java",
487            "../actor_iac.java",
488            System.getProperty("user.dir") + "/actor_iac.java",
489            workflowDir.getParent() + "/actor_iac.java"
490        };
491
492        for (String path : candidates) {
493            java.io.File file = new java.io.File(path);
494            if (file.exists() && file.canExecute()) {
495                return file.getAbsolutePath();
496            }
497        }
498
499        // Try to find via PATH
500        try {
501            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder("which", "actor_iac.java");
502            Process p = pb.start();
503            try (java.io.BufferedReader reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(
504                    new java.io.InputStreamReader(p.getInputStream()))) {
505                String line = reader.readLine();
506                if (line != null && !line.isBlank()) {
507                    return line.trim();
508                }
509            }
510        } catch (Exception e) {
511            // Ignore
512        }
513
514        return null;
515    }
516
517    /**
518     * Sets up text file logging via H2LogStore.
519     *
520     * <p>This method configures the H2LogStore to also write log entries
521     * to a text file, in addition to the H2 database. Only called when
522     * -l/--log option is explicitly specified.</p>
523     */
524    private void setupTextLogging() throws IOException {
525        Path logFilePath = logFile.toPath();
526
527        // Configure H2LogStore to also write to text file
528        ((H2LogStore) logStore).setTextLogFile(logFilePath);
529
530        LOG.info("Text logging enabled: " + logFilePath);
531    }
532
533    /**
534     * Configures log level based on verbose flag.
535     */
536    private void configureLogLevel(boolean verbose) {
537        Level targetLevel = verbose ? Level.FINE : Level.INFO;
538
539        // Configure root logger level
540        Logger rootLogger = Logger.getLogger("");
541        rootLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
542
543        // Configure handlers to respect the new level
544        for (java.util.logging.Handler handler : rootLogger.getHandlers()) {
545            handler.setLevel(targetLevel);
546        }
547
548        // Configure POJO-actor Interpreter logger
549        Logger interpreterLogger = Logger.getLogger("com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Interpreter");
550        interpreterLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
551
552        if (verbose) {
553            LOG.info("Verbose mode enabled - log level set to FINE");
554        }
555    }
556
557    /**
558     * Main execution logic.
559     */
560    private Integer executeMain() {
561        // Validate workflow directory
562        if (!workflowDir.exists()) {
563            LOG.severe("Workflow directory does not exist: " + workflowDir);
564            return 1;
565        }
566
567        if (!workflowDir.isDirectory()) {
568            LOG.severe("Not a directory: " + workflowDir);
569            return 1;
570        }
571
572        // Scan workflow directory recursively
573        LOG.info("Scanning workflow directory: " + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
574        scanWorkflowDirectory(workflowDir.toPath());
575
576        if (verbose) {
577            LOG.info("Discovered " + workflowCache.size() + " workflow files:");
578            workflowCache.forEach((name, file) ->
579                LOG.info("  " + name + " -> " + file.getPath()));
580        }
581
582        if (listWorkflows) {
583            printWorkflowList();
584            return 0;
585        }
586
587        // Handle --render-to option
588        if (renderToDir != null) {
589            return renderOverlayWorkflows();
590        }
591
592        if (workflowName == null || workflowName.isBlank()) {
593            LOG.severe("Workflow name is required unless --list-workflows is specified.");
594            return 1;
595        }
596
597        // Find main workflow
598        File mainWorkflowFile = findWorkflowFile(workflowName);
599        if (mainWorkflowFile == null) {
600            LOG.severe("Workflow not found: " + workflowName);
601            LOG.info("Available workflows: " + workflowCache.keySet());
602            return 1;
603        }
604
605        // Validate overlay directory if specified
606        if (overlayDir != null) {
607            if (!overlayDir.exists()) {
608                LOG.severe("Overlay directory does not exist: " + overlayDir);
609                return 1;
610            }
611            if (!overlayDir.isDirectory()) {
612                LOG.severe("Overlay path is not a directory: " + overlayDir);
613                return 1;
614            }
615        }
616
617        LOG.info("=== actor-IaC Workflow CLI ===");
618        LOG.info("Workflow directory: " + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
619        LOG.info("Main workflow: " + mainWorkflowFile.getName());
620        if (overlayDir != null) {
621            LOG.info("Overlay: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
622        }
623        LOG.info("Worker threads: " + threads);
624
625        // Execute workflow (use local inventory if none specified)
626        return executeWorkflow(mainWorkflowFile);
627    }
628
629    /**
630     * Renders overlay-applied workflows to the specified directory.
631     */
632    private Integer renderOverlayWorkflows() {
633        if (overlayDir == null) {
634            LOG.severe("--render-to requires --overlay to be specified");
635            return 1;
636        }
637
638        try {
639            // Create output directory if it doesn't exist
640            if (!renderToDir.exists()) {
641                if (!renderToDir.mkdirs()) {
642                    LOG.severe("Failed to create output directory: " + renderToDir);
643                    return 1;
644                }
645            }
646
647            LOG.info("=== Rendering Overlay-Applied Workflows ===");
648            LOG.info("Overlay directory: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
649            LOG.info("Output directory: " + renderToDir.getAbsolutePath());
650
651            WorkflowKustomizer kustomizer = new WorkflowKustomizer();
652            Map<String, Map<String, Object>> workflows = kustomizer.build(overlayDir.toPath());
653
654            org.yaml.snakeyaml.Yaml yaml = new org.yaml.snakeyaml.Yaml();
655
656            for (Map.Entry<String, Map<String, Object>> entry : workflows.entrySet()) {
657                String fileName = entry.getKey();
658                Map<String, Object> workflowContent = entry.getValue();
659
660                Path outputPath = renderToDir.toPath().resolve(fileName);
661
662                // Add header comment
663                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
664                sb.append("# Rendered from overlay: ").append(overlayDir.getName()).append("\n");
665                sb.append("# Source: ").append(fileName).append("\n");
666                sb.append("# Generated: ").append(LocalDateTime.now()).append("\n");
667                sb.append("#\n");
668                sb.append(yaml.dump(workflowContent));
669
670                Files.writeString(outputPath, sb.toString());
671                LOG.info("  Written: " + outputPath);
672            }
673
674            LOG.info("Rendered " + workflows.size() + " workflow(s) to " + renderToDir.getAbsolutePath());
675            return 0;
676
677        } catch (IOException e) {
678            LOG.severe("Failed to render workflows: " + e.getMessage());
679            return 1;
680        } catch (Exception e) {
681            LOG.severe("Error during rendering: " + e.getMessage());
682            e.printStackTrace();
683            return 1;
684        }
685    }
686
687    /**
688     * Executes workflow with node-based execution.
689     */
690    private Integer executeWorkflow(File mainWorkflowFile) {
691        NodeGroup nodeGroup;
692
693        // Prompt for password if --ask-pass is specified
694        String sshPassword = null;
695        if (askPass) {
696            sshPassword = promptForPassword("SSH password: ");
697            if (sshPassword == null) {
698                LOG.severe("Password input cancelled");
699                return 1;
700            }
701        }
702
703        IIActorSystem system = new IIActorSystem("actor-iac-cli", threads);
704
705        // Add dedicated thread pool for DB writes (single thread to serialize writes)
706        system.addManagedThreadPool(1);
707        dbExecutor = system.getManagedThreadPool(1);
708
709        // Create logStore actor if log database is configured
710        if (logStore != null) {
711            logStoreActor = system.actorOf("logStore", logStore);
712
713            // Start log session with execution context
714            String overlayName = overlayDir != null ? overlayDir.getName() : null;
715            String inventoryName = inventoryFile != null ? inventoryFile.getName() : null;
716
717            // Collect execution context for reproducibility
718            String cwd = System.getProperty("user.dir");
719            String gitCommit = getGitCommit(workflowDir);
720            String gitBranch = getGitBranch(workflowDir);
721            String commandLine = buildCommandLine();
722            String actorIacVersion = ACTORIAC_VERSION;
723            String actorIacCommit = getActorIacCommit();
724
725            sessionId = logStore.startSession(workflowName, overlayName, inventoryName, 1,
726                    cwd, gitCommit, gitBranch, commandLine, actorIacVersion, actorIacCommit);
727            logStore.log(sessionId, "cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Starting workflow: " + workflowName);
728        }
729
730        try {
731            if (inventoryFile != null) {
732                // Use specified inventory file
733                if (!inventoryFile.exists()) {
734                    LOG.severe("Inventory file does not exist: " + inventoryFile);
735                    logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Inventory file does not exist: " + inventoryFile);
736                    return 1;
737                }
738                LOG.info("Inventory: " + inventoryFile.getAbsolutePath());
739                nodeGroup = new NodeGroup.Builder()
740                    .withInventory(new FileInputStream(inventoryFile))
741                    .build();
742            } else {
743                // Use empty NodeGroup for local execution
744                LOG.info("Inventory: (none - using localhost)");
745                nodeGroup = new NodeGroup();
746            }
747
748            // Set SSH password if provided
749            if (sshPassword != null) {
750                nodeGroup.setSshPassword(sshPassword);
751                LOG.info("Authentication: password");
752            } else {
753                LOG.info("Authentication: ssh-agent");
754            }
755
756            // Set host limit if provided
757            if (limitHosts != null) {
758                nodeGroup.setHostLimit(limitHosts);
759                LOG.info("Host limit: " + limitHosts);
760            }
761
762            // Step 1: Create NodeGroupInterpreter
763            NodeGroupInterpreter nodeGroupInterpreter = new NodeGroupInterpreter(nodeGroup, system);
764            nodeGroupInterpreter.setWorkflowBaseDir(workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
765            if (overlayDir != null) {
766                nodeGroupInterpreter.setOverlayDir(overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
767            }
768            if (verbose) {
769                nodeGroupInterpreter.setVerbose(true);
770            }
771            // Create IaCStreamingAccumulator for cowsay display
772            IaCStreamingAccumulator accumulator = new IaCStreamingAccumulator();
773            if (cowfile != null && !cowfile.isBlank()) {
774                accumulator.setCowfile(cowfile);
775            }
776            nodeGroupInterpreter.setAccumulator(accumulator);
777
778            // Inject log store into interpreter for node-level logging
779            if (logStore != null) {
780                nodeGroupInterpreter.setLogStore(logStore, logStoreActor, dbExecutor, sessionId);
781            }
782
783            // Step 2: Create NodeGroupIIAR and register with system
784            NodeGroupIIAR nodeGroupActor = new NodeGroupIIAR("nodeGroup", nodeGroupInterpreter, system);
785            system.addIIActor(nodeGroupActor);
786
787            // Step 2.5: Create and register MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR
788            MultiplexerAccumulator multiplexer = new MultiplexerAccumulator();
789
790            // Add ConsoleAccumulator (unless --quiet is specified)
791            if (!quiet) {
792                multiplexer.addTarget(new ConsoleAccumulator());
793            }
794
795            // Add FileAccumulator if --file-log is specified
796            if (logFile != null) {
797                try {
798                    multiplexer.addTarget(new FileAccumulator(logFile.toPath()));
799                    LOG.info("File logging enabled: " + logFile.getAbsolutePath());
800                } catch (IOException e) {
801                    LOG.warning("Failed to create file accumulator: " + e.getMessage());
802                }
803            }
804
805            // Add DatabaseAccumulator if log store is configured
806            if (logStoreActor != null && sessionId >= 0) {
807                multiplexer.addTarget(new DatabaseAccumulator(logStoreActor, dbExecutor, sessionId));
808                LOG.fine("Database logging enabled for session: " + sessionId);
809            }
810
811            // Register multiplexer actor with the system
812            MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR multiplexerActor = new MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR(
813                "outputMultiplexer", multiplexer, system);
814            system.addIIActor(multiplexerActor);
815            LOG.fine("MultiplexerAccumulator registered as 'outputMultiplexer'");
816
817            // Add log handler to forward java.util.logging to multiplexer
818            MultiplexerLogHandler logHandler = new MultiplexerLogHandler(system);
819            logHandler.setLevel(java.util.logging.Level.ALL);
820            java.util.logging.Logger.getLogger("").addHandler(logHandler);
821
822            // Step 3: Load the main workflow (with overlay if specified)
823            ActionResult loadResult = loadMainWorkflow(nodeGroupActor, mainWorkflowFile, overlayDir);
824            if (!loadResult.isSuccess()) {
825                LOG.severe("Failed to load workflow: " + loadResult.getResult());
826                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Failed to load workflow: " + loadResult.getResult());
827                endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
828                return 1;
829            }
830
831            // Step 3.5: Create node actors if group is specified
832            if (groupName != null) {
833                LOG.info("Creating node actors for group: " + groupName);
834                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Creating node actors for group: " + groupName);
835                ActionResult createResult = nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("createNodeActors", "[\"" + groupName + "\"]");
836                if (!createResult.isSuccess()) {
837                    LOG.severe("Failed to create node actors: " + createResult.getResult());
838                    logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Failed to create node actors: " + createResult.getResult());
839                    endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
840                    return 1;
841                }
842                LOG.info("Node actors created: " + createResult.getResult());
843            }
844
845            // Step 4: Execute the workflow
846            LOG.info("Starting workflow execution...");
847            LOG.info("-".repeat(50));
848            logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Starting workflow execution");
849
850            long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
851            ActionResult result = nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("runUntilEnd", "[10000]");
852            long duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
853
854            LOG.info("-".repeat(50));
855            if (result.isSuccess()) {
856                LOG.info("Workflow completed successfully: " + result.getResult());
857                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Workflow completed successfully in " + duration + "ms");
858                endSession(SessionStatus.COMPLETED);
859                return 0;
860            } else {
861                LOG.severe("Workflow failed: " + result.getResult());
862                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Workflow failed: " + result.getResult());
863                endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
864                return 1;
865            }
866
867        } catch (Exception e) {
868            LOG.log(Level.SEVERE, "Workflow execution failed", e);
869            logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Exception: " + e.getMessage());
870            endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
871            return 1;
872        } finally {
873            system.terminate();
874        }
875    }
876
877    /**
878     * Logs a message to the distributed log store if available.
879     */
880    private void logToDb(String nodeId, LogLevel level, String message) {
881        if (logStore != null && sessionId >= 0) {
882            logStore.log(sessionId, nodeId, level, message);
883        }
884    }
885
886    /**
887     * Ends the current session with the given status.
888     */
889    private void endSession(SessionStatus status) {
890        if (logStore != null && sessionId >= 0) {
891            logStore.endSession(sessionId, status);
892        }
893    }
894
895    /**
896     * Prompts for a password from the console.
897     */
898    private String promptForPassword(String prompt) {
899        java.io.Console console = System.console();
900        if (console != null) {
901            // Secure input - password not echoed
902            char[] passwordChars = console.readPassword(prompt);
903            if (passwordChars != null) {
904                return new String(passwordChars);
905            }
906            return null;
907        } else {
908            // Fallback for environments without console (e.g., IDE)
909            System.out.print(prompt);
910            try (java.util.Scanner scanner = new java.util.Scanner(System.in)) {
911                if (scanner.hasNextLine()) {
912                    return scanner.nextLine();
913                }
914            }
915            return null;
916        }
917    }
918
919    /**
920     * Scans the directory recursively for workflow files.
921     */
922    private void scanWorkflowDirectory(Path dir) {
923        try (Stream<Path> paths = Files.walk(dir)) {
924            paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
925                 .filter(this::isWorkflowFile)
926                 .forEach(this::registerWorkflowFile);
927        } catch (IOException e) {
928            LOG.warning("Error scanning directory: " + e.getMessage());
929        }
930    }
931
932    /**
933     * Checks if a file is a workflow file (YAML, JSON, or XML).
934     */
935    private boolean isWorkflowFile(Path path) {
936        String name = path.getFileName().toString().toLowerCase();
937        return name.endsWith(".yaml") || name.endsWith(".yml") ||
938               name.endsWith(".json") || name.endsWith(".xml");
939    }
940
941    /**
942     * Registers a workflow file in the cache.
943     */
944    private void registerWorkflowFile(Path path) {
945        File file = path.toFile();
946        String fileName = file.getName();
947
948        // Register with full filename
949        workflowCache.put(fileName, file);
950
951        // Register without extension
952        int dotIndex = fileName.lastIndexOf('.');
953        if (dotIndex > 0) {
954            String baseName = fileName.substring(0, dotIndex);
955            // Only register base name if not already taken by another file
956            workflowCache.putIfAbsent(baseName, file);
957        }
958    }
959
960    /**
961     * Finds a workflow file by name.
962     */
963    public File findWorkflowFile(String name) {
964        // Try exact match first
965        File file = workflowCache.get(name);
966        if (file != null) {
967            return file;
968        }
969
970        // Try with common extensions
971        String[] extensions = {".yaml", ".yml", ".json", ".xml"};
972        for (String ext : extensions) {
973            file = workflowCache.get(name + ext);
974            if (file != null) {
975                return file;
976            }
977        }
978
979        return null;
980    }
981
982    /**
983     * Loads the main workflow file with optional overlay support.
984     */
985    private ActionResult loadMainWorkflow(NodeGroupIIAR nodeGroupActor, File workflowFile, File overlayDir) {
986        LOG.info("Loading workflow: " + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath());
987        logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Loading workflow: " + workflowFile.getName());
988
989        String loadArg;
990        if (overlayDir != null) {
991            // Pass both workflow path and overlay directory
992            loadArg = "[\"" + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath() + "\", \"" + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath() + "\"]";
993            LOG.fine("Loading with overlay: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
994        } else {
995            // Load without overlay
996            loadArg = "[\"" + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath() + "\"]";
997        }
998
999        return nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("readYaml", loadArg);
1000    }
1001
1002    private void printWorkflowList() {
1003        List<WorkflowDisplay> displays = scanWorkflowsForDisplay(workflowDir);
1004
1005        if (displays.isEmpty()) {
1006            System.out.println("No workflow files found under "
1007                + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
1008            return;
1009        }
1010
1011        System.out.println("Available workflows (directory: "
1012            + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath() + ")");
1013        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
1014        System.out.printf("%-4s %-25s %-35s %s%n", "#", "File (-w)", "Path", "Workflow Name (in logs)");
1015        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
1016        int index = 1;
1017        for (WorkflowDisplay display : displays) {
1018            String wfName = display.workflowName() != null ? display.workflowName() : "(no name)";
1019            System.out.printf("%2d.  %-25s %-35s %s%n",
1020                index++, display.baseName(), display.relativePath(), wfName);
1021        }
1022        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
1023        System.out.println("Use -w <File> with the names shown in the 'File (-w)' column.");
1024    }
1025
1026    /**
1027     * Prints available cowfiles for cowsay output customization.
1028     */
1029    private void printAvailableCowfiles() {
1030        System.out.println("Available cowfiles for --cowfile option:");
1031        System.out.println("=".repeat(70));
1032        System.out.println();
1033
1034        // Get list from Cowsay library
1035        String[] listArgs = { "-l" };
1036        String cowList = com.github.ricksbrown.cowsay.Cowsay.say(listArgs);
1037
1038        // Split and format nicely
1039        String[] cowfiles = cowList.trim().split("\\s+");
1040        System.out.println("Total: " + cowfiles.length + " cowfiles");
1041        System.out.println();
1042
1043        // Print in columns
1044        int cols = 4;
1045        int colWidth = 17;
1046        for (int i = 0; i < cowfiles.length; i++) {
1047            System.out.printf("%-" + colWidth + "s", cowfiles[i]);
1048            if ((i + 1) % cols == 0) {
1049                System.out.println();
1050            }
1051        }
1052        if (cowfiles.length % cols != 0) {
1053            System.out.println();
1054        }
1055
1056        System.out.println();
1057        System.out.println("=".repeat(70));
1058        System.out.println("Usage: actor_iac.java run -d <dir> -w <workflow> --cowfile tux");
1059        System.out.println();
1060        System.out.println("Popular choices:");
1061        System.out.println("  tux         - Linux penguin (great for server work)");
1062        System.out.println("  dragon      - Majestic dragon");
1063        System.out.println("  stegosaurus - Prehistoric dinosaur");
1064        System.out.println("  turtle      - Slow and steady");
1065        System.out.println("  ghostbusters - Who you gonna call?");
1066    }
1067
1068    private static String getBaseName(String fileName) {
1069        int dotIndex = fileName.lastIndexOf('.');
1070        if (dotIndex > 0) {
1071            return fileName.substring(0, dotIndex);
1072        }
1073        return fileName;
1074    }
1075
1076    private static String relativize(Path base, Path target) {
1077        try {
1078            return base.relativize(target).toString();
1079        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
1080            return target.toAbsolutePath().toString();
1081        }
1082    }
1083
1084    private static List<WorkflowDisplay> scanWorkflowsForDisplay(File directory) {
1085        if (directory == null) {
1086            return List.of();
1087        }
1088
1089        try (Stream<Path> paths = Files.walk(directory.toPath())) {
1090            Map<String, File> uniqueFiles = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1091            paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
1092                 .filter(path -> {
1093                     String name = path.getFileName().toString().toLowerCase();
1094                     return name.endsWith(".yaml") || name.endsWith(".yml")
1095                         || name.endsWith(".json") || name.endsWith(".xml");
1096                 })
1097                 .forEach(path -> uniqueFiles.putIfAbsent(path.toFile().getAbsolutePath(), path.toFile()));
1098
1099            Path basePath = directory.toPath();
1100            return uniqueFiles.values().stream()
1101                .map(file -> new WorkflowDisplay(
1102                    getBaseName(file.getName()),
1103                    relativize(basePath, file.toPath()),
1104                    extractWorkflowName(file)))
1105                .sorted(Comparator.comparing(WorkflowDisplay::baseName, String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER))
1106                .collect(Collectors.toList());
1107        } catch (IOException e) {
1108            System.err.println("Failed to scan workflows: " + e.getMessage());
1109            return List.of();
1110        }
1111    }
1112
1113    /**
1114     * Extracts the workflow name from a YAML/JSON/XML file.
1115     */
1116    private static String extractWorkflowName(File file) {
1117        String fileName = file.getName().toLowerCase();
1118        if (fileName.endsWith(".yaml") || fileName.endsWith(".yml")) {
1119            return extractNameFromYaml(file);
1120        } else if (fileName.endsWith(".json")) {
1121            return extractNameFromJson(file);
1122        }
1123        return null;
1124    }
1125
1126    /**
1127     * Extracts name field from YAML file using simple line parsing.
1128     */
1129    private static String extractNameFromYaml(File file) {
1130        try (java.io.BufferedReader reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(new java.io.FileReader(file))) {
1131            String line;
1132            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
1133                line = line.trim();
1134                // Look for "name: value" at the top level (not indented)
1135                if (line.startsWith("name:")) {
1136                    String value = line.substring(5).trim();
1137                    // Remove quotes if present
1138                    if ((value.startsWith("\"") && value.endsWith("\"")) ||
1139                        (value.startsWith("'") && value.endsWith("'"))) {
1140                        value = value.substring(1, value.length() - 1);
1141                    }
1142                    return value.isEmpty() ? null : value;
1143                }
1144                // Stop if we hit a steps: or other major section
1145                if (line.startsWith("steps:") || line.startsWith("vertices:")) {
1146                    break;
1147                }
1148            }
1149        } catch (IOException e) {
1150            // Ignore and return null
1151        }
1152        return null;
1153    }
1154
1155    /**
1156     * Extracts name field from JSON file.
1157     */
1158    private static String extractNameFromJson(File file) {
1159        try (java.io.FileReader reader = new java.io.FileReader(file)) {
1160            org.json.JSONTokener tokener = new org.json.JSONTokener(reader);
1161            org.json.JSONObject json = new org.json.JSONObject(tokener);
1162            return json.optString("name", null);
1163        } catch (Exception e) {
1164            // Ignore and return null
1165        }
1166        return null;
1167    }
1168
1169    /**
1170     * Record for displaying workflow information.
1171     */
1172    private static record WorkflowDisplay(String baseName, String relativePath, String workflowName) {}
1173
1174    /**
1175     * Gets the git commit hash of the specified directory.
1176     *
1177     * @param dir directory to check (uses current directory if null)
1178     * @return short git commit hash, or null if not a git repository
1179     */
1180    private String getGitCommit(File dir) {
1181        try {
1182            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder("git", "rev-parse", "--short", "HEAD");
1183            if (dir != null) {
1184                pb.directory(dir);
1185            }
1186            pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
1187            Process p = pb.start();
1188            String output = new String(p.getInputStream().readAllBytes()).trim();
1189            int exitCode = p.waitFor();
1190            return exitCode == 0 && !output.isEmpty() ? output : null;
1191        } catch (Exception e) {
1192            return null;
1193        }
1194    }
1195
1196    /**
1197     * Gets the git branch name of the specified directory.
1198     *
1199     * @param dir directory to check (uses current directory if null)
1200     * @return git branch name, or null if not a git repository
1201     */
1202    private String getGitBranch(File dir) {
1203        try {
1204            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder("git", "rev-parse", "--abbrev-ref", "HEAD");
1205            if (dir != null) {
1206                pb.directory(dir);
1207            }
1208            pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
1209            Process p = pb.start();
1210            String output = new String(p.getInputStream().readAllBytes()).trim();
1211            int exitCode = p.waitFor();
1212            return exitCode == 0 && !output.isEmpty() ? output : null;
1213        } catch (Exception e) {
1214            return null;
1215        }
1216    }
1217
1218    /**
1219     * Builds a command line string from the current options.
1220     *
1221     * @return command line string
1222     */
1223    private String buildCommandLine() {
1224        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("run");
1225        if (workflowDir != null) {
1226            sb.append(" -d ").append(workflowDir.getPath());
1227        }
1228        if (workflowName != null) {
1229            sb.append(" -w ").append(workflowName);
1230        }
1231        if (inventoryFile != null) {
1232            sb.append(" -i ").append(inventoryFile.getPath());
1233        }
1234        if (groupName != null && !groupName.equals("all")) {
1235            sb.append(" -g ").append(groupName);
1236        }
1237        if (overlayDir != null) {
1238            sb.append(" -o ").append(overlayDir.getPath());
1239        }
1240        if (threads != 4) {
1241            sb.append(" -t ").append(threads);
1242        }
1243        if (verbose) {
1244            sb.append(" -v");
1245        }
1246        if (quiet) {
1247            sb.append(" -q");
1248        }
1249        if (limitHosts != null) {
1250            sb.append(" --limit ").append(limitHosts);
1251        }
1252        return sb.toString();
1253    }
1254
1255    /**
1256     * Gets the git commit hash of the actor-IaC installation.
1257     * This looks for a .git directory relative to where actor-IaC is running.
1258     *
1259     * @return short git commit hash, or null if not available
1260     */
1261    private String getActorIacCommit() {
1262        // Try to get commit from the actor-IaC source directory if running in dev mode
1263        try {
1264            String classPath = RunCLI.class.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().getPath();
1265            File classFile = new File(classPath);
1266            // If running from target/classes, go up to project root
1267            if (classFile.getPath().contains("target")) {
1268                File projectRoot = classFile.getParentFile();
1269                while (projectRoot != null && !new File(projectRoot, ".git").exists()) {
1270                    projectRoot = projectRoot.getParentFile();
1271                }
1272                if (projectRoot != null) {
1273                    return getGitCommit(projectRoot);
1274                }
1275            }
1276        } catch (Exception e) {
1277            // Ignore
1278        }
1279        return null;
1280    }
1281}
